p: The EOCL (50 mg/kg, i.p.) caused significant (p < 0.05) decrease and at 100 and 200 mg/kg, i.p., it caused significant decrease (p < 0.01) in sleep latency {F (4,20) = 22.89} compared to control; Similarly, at the same dose levels, EOCL induced significant [p < 0.05–0.01; F (4,20) = 21] prolongation of ketamine-induced total sleeping time ( Fig. 5A–B).
